Levels.01: Barely discernible but repetitive movement
Levels.02: Clear movement with excursion of finger, wrist or ankle of less than 2 cm. Movement is either slight but sustained or stronger but briefer
Levels.03: Excursion of finger, wrist, or ankle greater than 2 cm and movement readily distinguished as mirroring (strong and sustained movement)
Levels.04: Pronounced mirroring, with amplitude approaching or matching the requested task in the opposite limb

Levels.01: Less than mirrored task (fewer fingers for instance)
Levels.02: Mirroring that involves the same areas as intended task
Levels.03: Mirroring spreads beyond the intended task areas

Levels.01: Mirroring occurs in less than 1/3 of the task intended cycles
Levels.02: Mirroring occurs in between 1/3 and 2/3 of the task cycles
Levels.03: Mirroring occurs for most of the task cycles (>2/3 of the task cycles)
